name: spellcraft
description: Your skill in the arcane.  Represents magic theory and all that entails.  A higher skill increases how quickly you can learn spells, and decreases their spell failure chance.  You learn this skill by studying books or spells.

level_descriptions_theory.description: You can’t tell a spellbook from a cookbook.
You’ve probably some utiliy spell or another for cleaning or other every day activities.
You understand the basics of magical flow and have studied the arcane in middle school.
You have probably attend formal education and can dissect must magical structures with ease.
You grasp the underlying logic of the arcane and have worked in some thaumathurgy research.
You've dissected more spell structures than you care to count, probably even improved a few spells.
You would have been know as the foremost expert in magical knowlodge, if anyone were still around to care, that is.

level_descriptions_practice.description: If you know a single spell, it probably fizzle, spark, and die in your hands.
You can manage a spark of energy—if the stars align and luck’s on your side.
You weave spells with deliberate care and can get reliable results.
Your incantations flow naturally, you adapt to magical feedback with ease.
You cast complex spells effortlessly, as if speaking a native tongue.
Magic obeys your will before you even voice it.
